parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To clothe; mid: I enter, creep into. From ennomos and duno; to sink (compare enduo) on, i.e. (figuratively) sneak.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To take captive (in war); I subdue, ensnare. From aichmalotos; to make captive.
A woman, with all a woman's weakness, a poor weak woman, a silly woman. A diminutive from gune; a little woman.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To heap up, load. From another form of soros; to pile up.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
